Macro.Name: Toggle Extended clipboard Numberpad
Macro.Action:
EventGhost.PythonScript(u'egg = eg.globals
n = egg.togglenumpad
if n == 0:
 egg.togglenumpad = 1
 print "Extended Clipboard online"
 eg.plugins.EventGhost.TriggerEvent(u'clip pad on', 0.0, None, False, False, False)
 
else:
 egg.togglenumpad = 0
 print "Extended Clipboard offline"
 eg.plugins.EventGhost.TriggerEvent(u'clip pad off', 0.0, None, False, False, False)')

Macro.Name: Move 1
Macro.Action:
EventGhost.PythonScript(u'
import win32api

eg.globals.h_x = 1
eg.globals.h_y = 1

def mPos(x, y):
 win32api.SetCursorPos((x, y))

# OR
#
#def mPos(coord):
# win32api.SetCursorPos(coord)

def start():
 eg.globals.h_x, eg.globals.h_y = win32api.GetCursorPos() #This works fine.
 print "Mouse was at " + str(eg.globals.h_x) + ", " + str(eg.globals.h_y) #This also displays normally.
 
 return eg.globals.h_x, eg.globals.h_y

eg.globals.h_x, eg.globals.h_y = start()

eg.globals.xtemp = eg.globals.h_x
eg.globals.ytemp = eg.globals.h_y
eg.globals.h_x = eg.globals.x1
eg.globals.h_y = eg.globals.y1 
eg.plugins.Mouse.MoveAbsolute(eg.globals.h_x, eg.globals.h_y, 2, False, True)
')

Macro.Name: Change cursor position by x:0, y:-32
Macro.Action:

Macro.Name: Folder by day's modified

Action.Name: Sort a folder into days modified folders

Macro.Action:
EventGhost.PythonScript(u"
import os
import shutil
import os.path, time
from datetime import datetime

import win32clipboard
win32clipboard.OpenClipboard()
clip = win32clipboard.GetClipboardData()
win32clipboard.CloseClipboard()
path = clip
 
lis = os.listdir(path)
lis.sort(key=lambda x: os.stat(os.path.join(path, x)).st_mtime)
 
# List only the files in the folder
files = [f for f in os.listdir(path) if os.path.isfile(os.path.join(path, f))]
 
 
# In[51]:
 
# change the current path 
os.chdir(path)
for x in files:
 # Get the last modified time and the creation time
 creation_time_string = time.ctime(os.path.getmtime(os.path.join(path, x)))
 modified_time_string = time.ctime(os.path.getmtime(os.path.join(path, x)))
 creation_datetime_obj = datetime.strptime(creation_time_string, '%a %b %d %H:%M:%S %Y')
 modified_datetime_obj = datetime.strptime(modified_time_string, '%a %b %d %H:%M:%S %Y')
 modified_date = str(modified_datetime_obj.day) + '-' + str(modified_datetime_obj.month) + '-' + str(modified_datetime_obj.year)
 # print(modified_date)
 
 if(os.path.isdir(modified_date)):
 shutil.move(os.path.join(path, x), modified_date)
 else:
 os.makedirs(modified_date)
 shutil.move(os.path.join(path, x), modified_date)")

Macro.Name: Listen to PDF
Macro.Action:
EventGhost.PythonScript(u'import PyPDF2
import os
from gtts import gTTS
import re
import win32clipboard
win32clipboard.OpenClipboard()
clip = win32clipboard.GetClipboardData()
win32clipboard.CloseClipboard()

file_path = clip
 
if(os.path.exists(file_path)):
 pass
else:
 print("File does not exists")
 exit()
 
f = open(file_path, 'rb')
 
# Get the no of pages in pdf
 
 
pdffile = PyPDF2.PdfFileReader(f)
no_of_pages = pdffile.getNumPages()
 
# Iterate all the pages
 
# Using regex to filter only words and numbers
 
# Concatenate the words in each page
 
string_words = ''
for pageno in range(no_of_pages):
 pi = pdffile.getPage(pageno)
 page = pdffile.getPage(pageno)
 content = page.extractText()
 textonly = re.findall(r'[a-zA-Z0-9]+', content)
 for word in textonly:
 string_words = string_words + ' ' + word
 
# Convert the string of words to mp3 file 
print(string_words)
tts = gTTS(text=string_words, lang='en')
tts.save("listen_pdf.mp3")')

Macro.Name: Sort images into resolutions
Macro.Action:
EventGhost.PythonScript(u'#Sort images into resolutions


import cv2		#Image processing library
import os,glob	#For os manipulation
 
im_4k = 0		#Initializing counts for each category
im_1080 = 0
im_720 = 0
 
os.system("mkdir 4K")	#Creating directories for each type
os.system("mkdir 1080p")
os.system("mkdir 720p")
 
for image in glob.glob('*.jpg'):	#Selecting images one by one
	print(image)
	img = cv2.imread(image)		#Reading image
	height, width, channel = img.shape	#getting image resolution
	if(width>=3840 and height>=2160):	#Comparing image resolutions and moving them accordingly
		os.system("move "+image+" 4K")
		im_4k = im_4k+1
		continue
	if(width>=1920 and height>=1080):
		os.system("move "+image+" 1080p")
		im_1080 = im_1080+1
		continue
	if(width>=1280 and height>=720):
		os.system("move "+image+" 720p")
		im_720 = im_720+1
		continue
print(im_4k," 4K images moved to 4K folder")	#Printing counts for each type
print(im_1080," 1080p images moved to 1080p folder")	
print(im_720," 720p images moved to 720p folder")	')

Macro.Name: Find all links
Macro.Action:
EventGhost.PythonScript(u'import requests
import re

# get url
url = input('Enter a URL (include `http://`): ')

# connect to the url
website = requests.get(url)

# read html
html = website.text

# use re.findall to grab all the links
links = re.findall('"((http|ftp)s?://.*?)"', html)

# output links
for link in links:
 print(link[0])')

Macro.Name: renamer
excution time

EventGhost.PythonScript(u'"""
ExecutionTime
This class is used for timing execution of code.
For example:
 timer = ExecutionTime()
 print 'Hello world!'
 print 'Finished in {} seconds.'.format(timer.duration())
"""


import time
import random


class ExecutionTime:
 def __init__(self):

Macro.Name: email crawler

EventGhost.PythonScript(u'import requests
import re

# get url
url = input('Enter a URL (include `http://`): ')

# connect to the url
website = requests.get(url)

# read html
html = website.text

# use re.findall to grab all the links
links = re.findall('"((http|ftp)s?://.*?)"', html)
emails = re.findall('([\w\.,]+@[\w\.,]+\.\w+)', html)


# print the number of links in the list
print("\nFound {} links".format(len(links)))
for email in emails:
 print(email)')

Macro.Name: url crtawler
Macro.Action:
EventGhost.PythonScript(u'import requests
import re
try:
 from urllib.parse import urljoin
except ImportError:
 from urlparse import urljoin

# regex
link_re = re.compile(r'href="(.*?)"')


def crawl(url):

 req = requests.get(url)

 # Check if successful
 if(req.status_code != 200):
 return []

 # Find links
 links = link_re.findall(req.text)

 print("\nFound {} links".format(len(links)))

 # Search links for emails
 for link in links:

 # Get an absolute URL for a link
 link = urljoin(url, link)

 print(link)

if __name__ == '__main__':
 crawl('http://www.eventghost.net/forum/viewtopic.php?t=5695')')

optimize image
ip geolocate
Macro.Action:
EventGhost.PythonScript(u'import csv
import requests


def get_addresses(filename):
 """
 Given a CSV file, this function returns a list of lists
 where each element (list) in the outer list contains the
 row info from the csv file.
 """
 all_addresses = []
 with open(filename, 'rt') as f:
 reader = csv.reader(f)
 for row in reader:
 all_addresses.append(row)
 return all_addresses


def get_geolocation(all_the_ip_address):
 """
 Given a list of lists from `get_addresses()`, this function
 returns an updated lists of lists containing the geolocation.
 """
 print("Getting geo information...")
 updated_addresses = []
 counter = 1
 # update header
 header_row = all_the_ip_address.pop(0)
 header_row.extend(['Country', 'City'])
 # get geolocation
 for line in all_the_ip_address:
 print("Grabbing geo info for row # {0}".format(counter))
 r = requests.get('https://freegeoip.net/json/{0}'.format(line[0]))
 line.extend([str(r.json()['country_name']), str(r.json()['city'])])
 updated_addresses.append(line)
 counter += 1
 updated_addresses.insert(0, header_row)
 return updated_addresses


def create_csv(updated_address_list):
 """
 Given the updated lists of lists from `get_geolocation()`, this function
 creates a new CSV.
 """
 import sys
 if sys.version_info >= (3, 0, 0):
 f = open('output.csv', 'w', newline='')
 else:
 f = open('output.csv', 'wb')
 with f:
 writer = csv.writer(f)
 writer.writerows(updated_address_list)
 print("All done!")


if __name__ == '__main__':
 csv_file = '25_sample_csv.csv'
 all_the_ip_address = get_addresses(csv_file)
 updated_address_list = get_geolocation(all_the_ip_address)
 create_csv(updated_address_list)')

Macro.Name: folder zipper
Macro.Action:
EventGhost.PythonScript(u"import os
from datetime import datetime
from zipfile import ZipFile


# set file name and time of creation
today = datetime.now()
file_name = 'zipper_' + today.strftime('%Y.%m.%dh%H%M') + '.zip'
dir_name = 'tmp/' # update path


def zipdir(path, zip):
 for root, dirs, files in os.walk(path):
 for file in files:
 zip.write(os.path.join(root, file))

if __name__ == '__main__':
 zipfile = ZipFile(file_name, 'w')
 zipdir(dir_name, zipfile)
 zipfile.close()")

if app:

Macro.Name: Multiload OSD
Macro.Action:
EventGhost.PythonScript(u'# import the OSD Frame class
from eg.CorePluginModule.EventGhost.ShowOSD import OSDFrame


# we have to make a subclass of the OSDFrame class
# because the frame never actually gets "shown" and it just draws to the screen.
# we need to do some overriding so the IsShown function will work.
class NewOSDFrame(OSDFrame):
 
 def __init__(self, parent):
 self._is_shown = False
 OSDFrame.__init__(self, parent)
 
 def IsShown(self):
 return self._is_shown
 
 def ShowOSD(self, *args, **kwargs):
 self._is_shown = True
 OSDFrame.ShowOSD(self, *args, **kwargs)
 
 def OnTimeout(self):
 self._is_shown = False
 OSDFrame.OnTimeout(self)

# because of how the OSDFrame class was coded it is set up in a manner 
# where the construction and the display of the OSD are 2 different calls
# It allows you to reuse the frames is needed.

# so this is what you do to handle this. we will create an eg.global
# that is a list and contains the frames. each time we want to show an OSD
# we will iterate over the list to see if there are any available to use.
# if not then create another instance and add it to the list.
# We can set the "name" of the frame for identification if for some 
# specific reason you want to be able to identify what the frame is.

# this is a clean one liner to check if the global exists. and if it doesn't then to make it.
eg.globals.osd_frames = getattr(eg.globals, 'osd_frames', [])

# here is the checking of a frame is shown or not

for frame in eg.globals.osd_frames:
 if not frame.IsShown():
 # this is going to seem odd. But because of the else after the loop
 # the frame variable is going to carry to outside of the loop.
 
 # we want to stop searching. when we use the break it will exit 
 # the loop in a manner that will not run the code in the else statement after the loop
 break
else:
 # either no frames exist or all are being used so create a new one and add it to the globals. 
 frame = NewOSDFrame(None)
 
 eg.globals.osd_frames += [frame]
 

# because the frame instance carried to outside of the for loop
# we only have to place the next lines of code in a single time.

# this is how you can set and get the name for identification

frame.SetName('Some Name')
print frame.GetName()

# we found a frame that is not being used. so pass the arguments to the frame.. 
# the arguments are identical to the ones you see when you use copy as python 
# on the Show OSD Action

# I am doing this for testing purposes. so if you run the script multiple times 
# inside of the 10 seconds you will see that multiple frames can be displayed.
alignment = len(eg.globals.osd_frames)

frame.ShowOSD(
 osdText="text to be displayed " + str(alignment),
 fontInfo='0;-35;0;0;0;700;0;0;0;0;3;2;1;34;Arial',
 textColour=(14, 220, 3),
 outlineColour=(0, 0, 0),
 alignment=alignment,
 offset=(0, 0),
 displayNumber=0,
 timeout=10.0,
 event=None,
 skin=None,
)
')

EventGhost.PythonScript(u'egg = eg.globals
egg.taskname = "Desk Setup"
#Shake

#Squeeze

#Print
egg.taskreplace3 = "*clear"
#Fab
egg.taskreplace4 = "*clear"
#Up
egg.taskreplace5 = "*clear"
#Uplong
egg.taskreplace6 = "*clear"
#Down
egg.taskreplace7 = "*clear"
#Downlong
egg.taskreplace8 = "*clear"
#Right
egg.taskreplace9 = "*clear"
#Left
egg.taskreplace10 = "*clear"
#Center
egg.taskreplace11 = "*clear"
#Lap 1
egg.taskreplace12 = "ghost cl"
#Lap 2
egg.taskreplace13 = "site visit tracker"
#Lap 3
egg.taskreplace14 = "clear job"
#Lap 4
egg.taskreplace15 = "input method select"

eg.plugins.EventGhost.TriggerEvent(u'make.intereface.xml', 0.0, None, False, False, False)')

Macro.Name: Generate new Interface xml
Macro.Action:
EventGhost.PythonScript(u'egg = eg.globals
template = "C:\\Users\\Dan.Edens\\Google Drive\\Join Files\\Stack\\Tasker imports\\Inputsourcetemplate.tsk.xml"
output = "C:\\Users\\Dan.Edens\\Google Drive\\Join Files\\Stack\\Tasker imports\\GeneratedTaskfiles\\"+egg.taskname+".tsk.xml"

#check to see if new setup form was run. Nearly pointless.
try:
 eg.globals.taskreplace1
except AttributeError:
 eg.plugins.EventGhost.TriggerEvent(u'Task.List.open', 0.0, None, False, False, False)
else:
 print "woot"
# Read in the file
with open(template, 'r') as file :
 filedata = file.read()
# Replace the target strings
filedata = filedata.replace('interface template', egg.taskname)
filedata = filedata.replace('task-1', egg.taskreplace1)
filedata = filedata.replace('task-2', egg.taskreplace2)
filedata = filedata.replace('task-3', egg.taskreplace3)
filedata = filedata.replace('task-4', egg.taskreplace4)
filedata = filedata.replace('task-5', egg.taskreplace5)
filedata = filedata.replace('task-6', egg.taskreplace6)
filedata = filedata.replace('task-7', egg.taskreplace7)
filedata = filedata.replace('task-8', egg.taskreplace8)
filedata = filedata.replace('task-9', egg.taskreplace9)
filedata = filedata.replace('task(10', egg.taskreplace10)
filedata = filedata.replace('task(11', egg.taskreplace11)
filedata = filedata.replace('task(12', egg.taskreplace12)
filedata = filedata.replace('task(13', egg.taskreplace13)
filedata = filedata.replace('task(14', egg.taskreplace14)
filedata = filedata.replace('task(15', egg.taskreplace15)
# Write the file out again
with open(output, 'w') as file:
 file.write(filedata)
#send to Tasker for importing
eg.plugins.AutoRemote.SendMessage(u'Pixel', u'http://goo.gl/VjAqkR', u'APA91bEdoLlyAUKL6RP1si7Mo25PaGVTxiG9XuNdKI9s1HsnfOOB0f2UOsndoDr2zZkvnYi7hMMBzZBCGlGXjEtHs1mjYeG_BqgDV_FmREao87vkDFvwAbq8SvlW97s7WFaISrDBNmcw', u'', u'', u'', u'', '', u'C:\\Users\\Dan.Edens\\Google Drive\\Join Files\\Stack\\Tasker imports\\GeneratedTaskfiles\\'+egg.taskname+'.tsk.xml', u'')

#define globals
eg.globals.h_x = 1
eg.globals.h_y = 1

def mPos(x, y):
 win32api.SetCursorPos((x, y))

#set x and y

Macro.Name: Paste then add increment
Macro.Action:
EventGhost.PythonScript(u"#TODO - Query new value if not int.
#TODO - Find and replace a value within the string 
#TODO - Test if Mathclip needs to be global for eg.plugin syntax
#---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
#Extended Clipboard - Clipboard Incrementer v0.3
#Paste a value, than add egg.matchinc to it's value.

#Standard shortcuts used across project.
egg = eg.globals
egp = eg.plugins

#Import current Clipboard contents
import win32clipboard
win32clipboard.OpenClipboard()
egg.mathclip = win32clipboard.GetClipboardData()
win32clipboard.CloseClipboard()

#Check if Increment variable is set.
try:
 eg.globals.mathinc
except AttributeError:
 #If the increment value isn't set, than Query.
 eg.plugins.EventGhost.TriggerEvent(u'Input.OK.math inc', 0.0, None, False, False, False)
 #egg.mathinc = 1 #Old option - default instead of query.
else:
 #Set mathclip as pervious value + the increment.
 eg.globals.mathclip=str(int(eg.globals.mathclip)+eg.globals.mathinc)

print eg.globals.mathclip
eg.plugins.System.SetClipboard(u'{eg.globals.mathclip}')")

EventGhost.PythonScript(u'#TODO - Query new value if not int.
#TODO - Find and replace a value within the string 
#TODO - Test if Mathclip needs to be global for eg.plugin syntax
#---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
#Extended Clipboard - Clipboard Incrementer v0.3
#Paste a value, than add egg.matchinc to it's value.

#Standard shortcuts used across project.
egg = eg.globals
egp = eg.plugins

#Define variable
egg.mathclip = 1 

#Import current Clipboard contents
import win32clipboard
win32clipboard.OpenClipboard()
egg.mathclip = win32clipboard.GetClipboardData()
win32clipboard.CloseClipboard()

#Check imported value for Int, throw query if false.
try:
 egg.mathclip += 1
 #Replace with "isinstance(<var>, int)" for Python 3
 #isinstance(<egg.mathclip>, (int, long))
except TypeError:
 print "Clipboard contents expected int(). Please set starting Value"
 egp.EventGhost.TriggerEvent(u'.math_base', 0.0, None, False, False, False)
 
#Check if Increment variable is set.
try:
 egg.mathinc
except AttributeError:
 #If the increment value isn't set, than Query.
 egp.EventGhost.TriggerEvent(u'Input.OK.math inc', 0.0, None, False, False, False)
 #egg.mathinc = 1 #Old option - default instead of query.
else:
 #Set mathclip as pervious value + the increment.
 egg.mathclip=str(int(egg.mathclip)+egg.mathinc)

 

print egg.mathclip
egp.System.SetClipboard(u'{egg.mathclip}')


')

EventGhost.PythonScript(u'#TODO - Query new value if not int.
#TODO - Find and replace a value within the string 
#TODO - Test if Mathclip needs to be global for eg.plugin syntax
#TODO - Finish Test for initial value being int
#---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
#Extended Clipboard - Clipboard Incrementer v0.5
#Paste a value, than add eg.globals.matchinc to it's value.

#Standard shortcuts used across project.
#egg = eg.globals (ran into errors, revert to fullname until stable)#
egp = eg.plugins

#Define variable
eg.globals.mathclip = 1 

#Import current Clipboard contents
import win32clipboard
win32clipboard.OpenClipboard()
eg.globals.mathclip = win32clipboard.GetClipboardData()
win32clipboard.CloseClipboard()

#Check imported value for Int, throw query if false.
#tmp = eg.globals.mathclip
try:
 eg.globals.mathinc
 #Replace with "isinstance(<var>, int)" for Python 3
 #isinstance(<eg.globals.mathclip>, (int, long))
 #tmp += 1
#except TypeError:
except AttributeError:
 #print "Clipboard contents expected int(). Please set starting Value"
 egp.EventGhost.TriggerEvent(u'.math_base', 0.0, None, False, False, False)
 
#Check if Increment variable is set.
try:
 eg.globals.mathinc
except AttributeError:
 #If the increment value isn't set, than Query.
 egp.EventGhost.TriggerEvent(u'Input.OK.math inc', 0.0, None, False, False, False)
 #eg.globals.mathinc = 1 #Old option - default instead of query.
else:
 #Set mathclip as pervious value + the increment.
 eg.globals.mathclip=str(int(eg.globals.mathclip)+int(eg.globals.mathinc))

Macro.Name: Main
Macro.Action:
EventGhost.PythonScript(u'import shutil
import os
import sys
#Send all matched filetypes into Downloads storage
IgnoreFileTypes = 'exe,msi,apk,.gz,tar,gin,zip'
#Prevents attempts to move temp files while downloading.
IgnoreDownTypes = 'oad,tmp'

sorter = "C:\\Users\\Dan.Edens\\Desktop\\Sorting\\Autosorter\\"

#if eg.event.payload != "none":
 #Files = ''.join(eg.event.payload)
#else:
Files = os.listdir(sorter)


for f in Files:
 FileExtension = f[-3:]
 if IgnoreDownTypes.find(FileExtension) != -1:
 eg.plugins.EventGhost.TriggerEvent(u'download.wait', 0.0)
 eg.plugins.EventGhost.StopProcessing()
 
 elif IgnoreFileTypes.find(FileExtension) != 1:
 #presort if jobname is already in filename
 if "receipt" in f:
 shutil.move(sorter+f,'C:\\Users\\Dan.Edens\\Pictures\\Receipt\\'+f)
 print "Sorted to Receipt"
 elif "audi" in f:
 shutil.move(sorter+f,eg.globals.jobspacepath+'Houston.Audi_Central_Houston\\'+f)
 print "Sorted to Audi"
 elif "capiol" in f:
 shutil.move(sorter+f,eg.globals.jobspacepath+'Austin.Capital_Complex\\'+f) 
 print "Sorted to Capitol"
 elif "river" in f:
 shutil.move(sorter+f,eg.globals.jobspacepath+'Austin.425_Riverside\\'+f) 
 print "Sorted to Riverside"
 elif "texasint" in f:
 shutil.move(sorter+f,eg.globals.jobspacepath+'Houston.TexasInternational\\'+f) 
 print "Sorted to Texas Int"
 elif "onion" in f:
 shutil.move(sorter+f,eg.globals.jobspacepath+'SanAnt.6thOnion\\'+f) 
 print "Sorted to 6th and Onion"
 else:
 #print f
 #print eg.globals.jobpath
 #print sorter
 shutil.move(sorter+f,eg.globals.jobpath+f)
 print eg.globals.jobpath+f
 
 #turned this off for now
 elif IgnoreFileTypes.find(FileExtension) != -1:
 shutil.move(sorter+f,'C:\\Users\\Dan.Edens\\Downloads\\')
 print "Transfer to Programs complete"

#TODO: add exception for already existing file, appending a number to name.
')

Macro.Name: Multiload OSD
Macro.Action:
EventGhost.PythonScript(u'# import the OSD Frame class
from eg.CorePluginModule.EventGhost.ShowOSD import OSDFrame


# we have to make a subclass of the OSDFrame class
# because the frame never actually gets "shown" and it just draws to the screen.
# we need to do some overriding so the IsShown function will work.
class NewOSDFrame(OSDFrame):
 
 def __init__(self, parent):
 self._is_shown = False
 OSDFrame.__init__(self, parent)
 
 def IsShown(self):
 return self._is_shown
 
 def ShowOSD(self, *args, **kwargs):
 self._is_shown = True
 OSDFrame.ShowOSD(self, *args, **kwargs)
 
 def OnTimeout(self):
 self._is_shown = False
 OSDFrame.OnTimeout(self)

# because of how the OSDFrame class was coded it is set up in a manner 
# where the construction and the display of the OSD are 2 different calls
# It allows you to reuse the frames is needed.

# so this is what you do to handle this. we will create an eg.global
# that is a list and contains the frames. each time we want to show an OSD
# we will iterate over the list to see if there are any available to use.
# if not then create another instance and add it to the list.
# We can set the "name" of the frame for identification if for some 
# specific reason you want to be able to identify what the frame is.

# this is a clean one liner to check if the global exists. and if it doesn't then to make it.
eg.globals.osd_frames = getattr(eg.globals, 'osd_frames', [])

# here is the checking of a frame is shown or not

for frame in eg.globals.osd_frames:
 if not frame.IsShown():
 # this is going to seem odd. But because of the else after the loop
 # the frame variable is going to carry to outside of the loop.
 
 # we want to stop searching. when we use the break it will exit 
 # the loop in a manner that will not run the code in the else statement after the loop
 break
else:
 # either no frames exist or all are being used so create a new one and add it to the globals. 
 frame = NewOSDFrame(None)
 
 eg.globals.osd_frames += [frame]
 

# because the frame instance carried to outside of the for loop
# we only have to place the next lines of code in a single time.

# this is how you can set and get the name for identification

frame.SetName('Some Name')
print frame.GetName()

# we found a frame that is not being used. so pass the arguments to the frame.. 
# the arguments are identical to the ones you see when you use copy as python 
# on the Show OSD Action

# I am doing this for testing purposes. so if you run the script multiple times 
# inside of the 10 seconds you will see that multiple frames can be displayed.
alignment = len(eg.globals.osd_frames)

frame.ShowOSD(
 osdText="text to be displayed " + str(alignment),
 fontInfo='0;-35;0;0;0;700;0;0;0;0;3;2;1;34;Arial',
 textColour=(14, 220, 3),
 outlineColour=(0, 0, 0),
 alignment=alignment,
 offset=(0, 0),
 displayNumber=0,
 timeout=10.0,
 event=None,
 skin=None,
)
')

EventGhost.PythonScript(u'from eg.CorePluginModule.EventGhost.ShowOSD import OSDFrame

class NewOSDFrame(OSDFrame):
 
 def __init__(self, parent):
 self._is_shown = False
 OSDFrame.__init__(self, parent)
 
 def IsShown(self):
 return self._is_shown
 
 def ShowOSD(self, *args, **kwargs):
 self._is_shown = True
 OSDFrame.ShowOSD(self, *args, **kwargs)
 
 def OnTimeout(self):
 self._is_shown = False
 OSDFrame.OnTimeout(self)
eg.globals.osd_frames = getattr(eg.globals, 'osd_frames', [])

for frame in eg.globals.osd_frames:
 if not frame.IsShown():
 break

 timeout=10.0,
 event=None,
 skin=None,
)
')
